chapter.title: Nulgrind: the minimal Valgrind tool
chapter.para: To use this tool, you must specify --tool=none on the Valgrind command line.

sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: Nulgrind is the simplest possible Valgrind tool. It performs no instrumentation or analysis of a program, just runs it normally. It is mainly of use for Valgrind's developers for debugging and regression testing.

Nonetheless you can run programs with Nulgrind. They will run roughly 5 times more slowly than normal, for no useful effect. Note that you need to use the option --tool=none to run Nulgrind (ie. not --tool=nulgrind).
